com.i2group.apollo.model.builders.propertyvalue.typed
Class DateTimePropertyValueBuilder

java.lang.Object
  com.i2group.apollo.model.builders.propertyvalue.typed.DateTimePropertyValueBuilder
All Implemented Interfaces:
IBuilder<CompoundPropertyValue>
public final class DateTimePropertyValueBuilder
extends Object
implements IBuilder<CompoundPropertyValue>

An IBuilder for creating CompoundPropertyValues that contain values of type LogicalType.DATE_AND_TIME.

If elements of a CompoundPropertyValue are not set before it is called, the build() method attempts to provide default values.

Since:
5.0

Method Detail

build

public CompoundPropertyValue build()
Validates the data in the builder, and then creates and returns the object.

Note: The builder performs some validation of the object that it creates, but the object is not guaranteed to pass server validation.

For values of type LogicalType.DATE_AND_TIME, the primary date, time, and time zone are mandatory.

If the builder contains no data for the DST part of the value, then this method derives it from the date, time, and time zone.

If the builder contains no data for the UTC part of the value, then this method calculates it from the date, time, and time zone.

If the builder contains no data for the calculated part of the value, then the created CompoundPropertyValue does not contain it either.

If the builder contains no data for the calculated DST part of the value, then the created CompoundPropertyValue does not contain it either.

Specified by:
build in interface IBuilder<CompoundPropertyValue>
Returns:
See above.

setToNow

public DateTimePropertyValueBuilder setToNow()
Sets all parts of the value in this DateTimePropertyValueBuilder from the current date, time, time zone, and DST setting.

Returns:
This DateTimePropertyValueBuilder.

setToSystemTimeZone

public DateTimePropertyValueBuilder setToSystemTimeZone()
Sets the part of the value in this DateTimePropertyValueBuilder that contains the time zone from the return value of Calendar.getTimeZone().

Returns:
This DateTimePropertyValueBuilder.

setDateTime

public DateTimePropertyValueBuilder setDateTime(Date date)
Sets the part of the value in this DateTimePropertyValueBuilder that contains the date and time from the specified Date.

Note: This method does not set the part of the value that contains the time zone.

Parameters:
date - A Date that contains the date and time to be set.
Returns:
This DateTimePropertyValueBuilder.

setDateTime

public DateTimePropertyValueBuilder setDateTime(Calendar calendar)
Sets the part of the value in this DateTimePropertyValueBuilder that contains the date and time from the specified Calendar.

Note: This method also sets the part of the value that contains the time zone from the return value of Calendar.getTimeZone().

Parameters:
calendar - A Calendar that contains the date and time to be set.
Returns:
This DateTimePropertyValueBuilder.

setDateTime

public DateTimePropertyValueBuilder setDateTime(XMLGregorianCalendar calendar)

Note: This method also sets the part of the value that contains the time zone from the return value of XMLGregorianCalendar.getTimeZone(int).

Parameters:
calendar - An XMLGregorianCalendar that contains the date and time to be set.

This DateTimePropertyValueBuilder.

populate

public DateTimePropertyValueBuilder populate(CompoundPropertyValue propertyValue)
Description copied from interface: IBuilder
Populates the data in the builder from an object of the same type that the builder creates.

Assuming an implementation of T.equals(), then after this statement:

t2 = builder.populate(t1).build();

The following expressions should both evaluate to true:

t2.equals(t1) == true
(t2 == t1) == false

Specified by:
populate in interface IBuilder<CompoundPropertyValue>
Parameters:
propertyValue - The object from which to populate the builder.
Returns:
The builder, populated with the data from the specified object.

isPopulated

public boolean isPopulated()
Indicates whether the mandatory parts (date, time, and time zone) of the value in this DateTimePropertyValueBuilder are set.

Returns:
true if the mandatory parts of the value are set; false otherwise.
